item.title: Creating a Two-Spine, Two-Leaf Topology
item.description: To create a two-spine/two-leaf configuration, you start by importing the OVA image into VirtualBox four times, as each instance of the VM represents one leaf or spine switch (Cumulus VX-leaf1, Cumulus VX-leaf2, Cumulus VX-spine1 and Cumulus VX-spine2). Then you configure each VM’s network interfaces and routing settings. Configuring the leaf1 VM Import the Cumulus VX-leaf1 VM into VirtualBox, then configure its settings. Double-click the OVA image file to open VirtualBox.

item.title: An Alternative Method for Adding More Nodes to the Network
item.description: Another way you can add a VM to one or more of the internal virtual networks in VirtualBox is by cloning the VM. However, keep the following in mind: To quickly set up any configurations that you want across multiple nodes on your system, configure the settings on the original VM, then clone the VM using Machine > Clone. For example, if you want to include a management VM for the new topology you are going to create, you can set the eth0 port to be on a virtual network that the management VM is on, so when you clone the new VM, it will duplicate this port, giving you an out-of-band (OOB) network.
